{{also|meer|-meer}} ==Alemannic German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|gmh|mere}}, {{m|gmh|mer}}, from {{inh|gsw|goh|meri}}, from {{inh|gsw|gem-pro|*mari}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|Meer}}, {{cog|nl|meer||lake}}, {{cog|en|mere||sea, lake}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Zurich}} {{IPA|gsw|/meːr/}} ===Noun=== {{head|gsw|noun|g=n|plural|Meer}} # [[sea]] {{topics|gsw|Landforms|Water}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|mere}}, {{m|gmh|mer}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|meri}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*mari}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*móri}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|meer||lake}}, {{cog|nds|Meer}}, {{m|nds|meer}}, {{cog|en|mere||sea, lake}}. Via Indo-European is cognate with {{cog|la|mare}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/meːɐ̯/}} * {{audio|de|De-Meer.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Meer.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{homophones|de|mehr}} * {{rhymes|de|eːɐ̯}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Meers|gen2=Meeres|Meere}} # [[sea]] # {{lb|de|archaic|except in placenames}} [[lake]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|(e)s|e}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|sea}} {{l|de|See|g=f}} * {{sense|lake}} {{l|de|See|g=m}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|Meeresboden}} * {{l|de|Meerkatze}} * {{l|de|Meerrettich}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|Meerschaum}} * {{l|de|Meerschweinchen}} * {{l|de|Wattenmeer}} {{der-bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
